title: What song have you been listening to a lot of recently? - Quora

response.answer_text: Woah, A2A’d for my own question, wonder how that happened (Thanks Anna Sharudenko ) So I like primarily 5 genres that I’ll consistently listen to, some more than others. It turns out that now I’m on a Hip-Hop binge. The five genres, from all time favorite to least is Metal. Especially melodic death metal (After the burial, Children of Bodom, Kalmah, Born of Osiris).Classic Rock. Especially Jimi Hendrix, and other 60’s classic rock. 70’s and 80’s are good as well.Hip-Hop. 90% of what I listen to is pre 2004. This includes NWA, Wu-Tang Clan, Biggie, Method Man and RedmanElectronic Music. I listen to this when I’m gaming. This ranges from chip tunes to house music.Classical. When I study. Funny enough, I started listening to classical music because I was a dumb college freshman who believed in the Mozart effect - Wikipedia. I thought that was the reason that I did well on that economics test lol. But yeah it pretty much stuckNow in terms of specific songs I like now, here’s another list: Metal Listen to those harsh vocals and clean voice. A combination which showcases her talent. Broken down like a court case none the less, the harsh voice is the prosecution, the clean is the defendant. Pretty creative IMO. Hip-Hop He rhymes Orange with things, that’s pretty damn impressive Classic Rock Could play this song’s solo live with his teeth… WITH HIS TEETH Electronic music This song incorporates a sound bit from a game I play, Hearthstone. The “Get Down” voice is from the card “Noble Sacrifice.” You can see why I like this song for gaming. 5. Classical. While I’ve been doing work I’ve been listening to this compilation.  This compilation got me through undergrad and grad school. I’ve listened to it 100’s of times but still come back for more. Thanks for the A2A again :D

It’s a medley of three songs that I found on youtube — Half-breed; Gypsies, Tramps and Thieves; and Dark Lady. All by Cher of course. She’s singing them live in the video. I’m a big fan of narrative songs, and all three of these are narratives. I’m also a big fan of 70s music, which I didn’t really get into until I pretty much gave up on contemporary music in the early 2000s. A lot of the stuff from the 70s is new to me. I’ve listen to this melody four times today. Twice when walking my dog, once when making dinner, and I’m listening to it as I write this.
